title: Withholding marriage contract payment
vignette: A husband refuses to pay his wife's marriage contract amount after divorce claiming financial hardship.

options.text: Enforce full payment regardless of hardship.
Allow delayed installments until he can pay.

title: Postponing the wedding for illness
vignette: The bride falls ill right before the set wedding date. The families debate delaying the ceremony.

options.text: Postpone until she recovers fully.
Hold the wedding as planned with minimal festivities.

title: Valid witness absent
vignette: One witness to the marriage contract contract cannot attend the signing due to travel restrictions.

options.text: Proceed with a single witness to avoid delay.
Wait until two proper witnesses can sign.

title: Increasing the dowry after engagement
vignette: The bride's father promises additional dowry to entice the groom after the match is made.

options.text: Accept the increased dowry to secure the match.
Decline and keep the agreement as originally set.

title: Widow's marriage rights
vignette: A widow wants her new husband to inherit her late husband's property along with paying the marriage contract.

options.text: Permit the new husband to inherit once married.
Keep the property for her children from the first marriage.

title: Husband relocating cities
vignette: The husband plans to move for work while the wife wants to stay near her parents.

options.text: She must follow him to the new city.
He should defer and remain in her hometown.

title: Early marriage contract payment demanded
vignette: The wife argues that her husband neglected her and demands immediate marriage contract payment without divorce.

options.text: Require divorce first before collecting.
Allow partial payment now as goodwill.

title: Pledge of personal property
vignette: To secure a large marriage contract sum, the groom offers his family heirloom as collateral.

options.text: Accept the heirloom as security for the marriage contract.
Rely on his verbal commitment without collateral.

title: Bride refuses intimacy
vignette: After the wedding, the bride repeatedly declines conjugal relations citing anxiety.

options.text: Give her time and provide support without pressure.
Insist on marital rights immediately.

title: Wife supporting the household
vignette: The wife earns enough to support them both, but the husband prefers she focus on home duties.

options.text: Encourage her career to sustain the family.
Ask her to stop working and rely on his income.

title: Sustenance during husband's travel
vignette: The husband leaves for months of business travel and sends little money back home.

options.text: Require regular support payments while away.
Trust he will settle accounts on return.

title: Collecting the marriage contract from land or cash
vignette: The wife wants land, but the husband only offers cash for the marriage contract value.

options.text: She may demand land even if harder for him.
Accept the cash equivalent to end dispute.

title: Witness tampering suspected
vignette: A relative of the groom pressures witnesses to sign favorable terms in the contract.

options.text: Reject the marriage contract until unbiased witnesses sign.
Allow the signing to proceed to avoid embarrassment.

title: High marriage contract vs modest sum
vignette: The couple debates whether a large marriage contract shows commitment or creates undue burden.

options.text: Set a small, manageable amount.
Increase the sum to demonstrate esteem.

title: Moving to head office clause
vignette: The husband includes a clause requiring relocation to head office within a year.

options.text: Agree and prepare to move when possible.
Omit the clause until both are ready.
